SENT.plain: Functional pulmonary atresia is characterized by a structurally normal pulmonary valve not opening during right ventricular ejection
We report this rare condition in a premature newborn of a twin pregnancy, in which fetal echocardiography findings were consistent with critical pulmonary stenosis
After birth, features of neonatal Marfan's syndrome were noted
Echocardiography showed a morphologically normal but immobile pulmonary valve with continuous regurgitation
In this case, initial treatment with nitric oxide, followed by pharmacological duct closure, was successful
Differentiating between anatomic and functional pulmonary valve atresia may be difficult
